compounddef.title: RAD2DEG Radians To Degrees Conversion Function

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Converts the argument array from radians to degrees. The general syntax for its use is y = rad2deg(x) Note that the output type will be the same as the input type, and that complex arguments are allowed. The output is not wrapped to [0,360).

para.verbatim:
--> rad2deg(1) % one radian is about 57 degrees
ans = 57.2958
--> rad2deg(pi/4) % should be 45 degrees
ans = 45
--> rad2deg(2*pi) % Note that this is 360 not 0 degrees
ans = 360
